1 Overview

TODO

Revise based on narrative

1.1 Problem Statement

1.2 The Data

For this exercise, we will use the residential real estate transaction data from REALIS. This provides comprehensive and up-to-date statistics on the property market in Singapore.

The dataset has been provided via eLearn and added to the data/ folder of this exercise.

1.3 Methodology

2 Setup

2.1 Loading the R packages

For this exercise, we will mainly use the following packages:

  • tidyverse:

Aside from these, we will also include other packages that will help us present the data better.

  • knitr: used for dynamic report generation in R. For this exercise, we will use this package to render our tables better.
pacman::p_load(knitr, tidyverse)

2.2 Import the datasets

First, we need to import the provided datasets. We will use read_csv() for each csv file to do this.

  • ResidentialTransaction20240308160536.csv
  • ResidentialTransaction20240308160736.csv
  • ResidentialTransaction20240308161009.csv
  • ResidentialTransaction20240308161109.csv
  • ResidentialTransaction20240414220633.csv
res_txn1 <- read_csv('data/ResidentialTransaction20240308160536.csv')
kable(head(res_txn1, n=10))
